text: Dear lord this song is awful ... I know it's hard though finding music when you're up to playlist 6
author: Matt

text: +fafillionaire I have to disagree. I think it's great. The way it progressively develops, the way the background becomes the main melody and a bridge to the next part, the way it sounds like a rock solo in some parts, the way it accurately gives me imagery of jungles (which is where the game takes place, I assume), and so on. Also, it just sounds rad.
author: Marcus Mührmann-Lund

text: +fafillionaire yeah you definitely need a certain kind of open mind to enjoy these beeps and bloops.
author: ragnaroktomorrow

text: +fafillionaire I like it a lot so there is that

text: Everytime I hear one of his songs I get more and more convinced that Gonzalez is the best chiptune musician ever... I just can't get enough of his songs!

text: Alberto J. González if you ever get to work with Tim Follin together and release an album, I'm gonna buy it for at least 50 if not more bucks no joke.
author: Marinello Vragovic

text:
Your music is really good bro.
Did you only do work on the GBC Turok ports? Or did you do work for other games?
author: MetalModelMF

text: @MetalModelMF - He worked for almost all of the infogrames games. Check the wikipedia page about him, it's got a list of all the games he worked on
author: Retro CreaTbJ

text:
Alberto Gonzalez?
By the sound of it, I could have sworn this was Follin!
Love it!
author: Mace Stampede

text: Mace Stampede Follin and Gonzalez have about the same skill at being a god at chiptune composition. if they had worked together on any masterpiece of 8-bit game, it would have easily been the best 8-bit game in history
author: Marinello Vragovic

text: They do have similar aspects to their style.  I am finding that Follin's songs tend to have a more aggressive rock style though.  Gonzalez uses a lot of similar effects and melodic runs, but his styles have more of a folky or ethnic feel.
author: Chris Wood

text: Didn't know of Alberto Gonzalez before introducing myself into the great world of Supradarky's lists. Now I'm completely addicted to AG's work as a composer. So proud of being Spanish now :)
author: MrSolracvstheWorld

text: Oh man, that beat. The composer show an absolutely excellent control of the tempo and rhythm in this tune, making it a real pleasure to listen to.

text: Sounds very Follins-esque
author: BigAngryPhil

text:
While the handled Turok games stood into the 2D plataformer perspective, the juggernauts made for the home consoles were the 3D FPS environment perspective. I played and enjoyed every single one of them, heck, even Evolution is still a beloved game for me. 
I still have to read the comics, the books and watch the animated movie of "Son of Stone" though. For a 57 year old franchise, it sure made a lot of impressive work.

Now, it only needs to be resurrected PROPERLY in these times.
author: Necromagenvion Ω

text: the soundtrack of Turok 2 : seed of evil, is AMAZING ! don't you think  ?

author: thecristovar

text:
The only Turok games I played are the first two on the N64 and I loved them. The first Turok game will always be my favorite, I have a special spot for it. I had tons of fun with it as a kid, especially with the funny ingame cheats. The atmosphere was something else too.

This Gameboy version had great music by Gonzalez but the game itself was a 2D platformer so that's not really what I was looking for in﻿ a Turok game.
author: SupraDarky
